cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 165 mi (265 km) southeast of Biloxi, Mississippi
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest today, then slowing and turning northwest toward the southeastern Louisiana coast before drifting northward along the northern Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana / Mississippi coast (within the Morgan City, LA – MS/AL border hurricane-warning area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Indian Pass FL to Ochlockonee River FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Morgan City LA to MS/AL border; Tropical Storm Warning MS/AL border to Indian Pass FL; Storm-Surge Warning Port Fourchon LA to AL/FL border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeastern Louisiana eastward across Mississippi, Alabama and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Only a low (≤5%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy gusts possible but sustained gale unlikely
weather_observation.storm_surge: Outer-shelf setup could push 1–3 ft of surge north of Tampa Bay, but exceedance of 3 ft is not expected at the port
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands may bring 1–3 inches of rain to west-central Florida, including Tampa, through Monday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and higher-than-normal swells along the west-central Florida coast
